sub section 1.1: In Q2 2023, GFS reported revenue of $1.845 billion, reflecting a QoQ increase from $1.825 billion in Q1 and a YoY increase of approximately $20 million. The revenue growth was driven by improved operational performance and increased demand in the semiconductor market, consistent with the guidance from Q1, which projected revenue between $1.825 billion and $1.87 billion.

sub section 1.2: In Q2 2023, GFS shipped approximately 573,000 300-millimeter equivalent wafers, generating total revenue of about $1.845 billion. The average selling price (ASP) per wafer declined approximately 1% year-over-year due to changes in the product mix.

sub section 2.1: For Q2 2023, GFS's segment sales breakdown was as follows: Communications Infrastructure and Data Center contributed approximately 12% of revenue, with a decline due to reduced demand; Personal Computing contributed about 3% of revenue, also reflecting a year-over-year decline. Adjusted gross profit was $546 million, indicating an overall adjusted gross margin of approximately 29.6%.

sub section 2.2: For Q3 2023, GFS anticipates moderate challenges in certain segments while expecting healthy demand in faster-growing markets like automotive and industrial IoT.
